Summary If you're looking to connect with me socially then you can find me on Facebook.  
 
Here I want to talk about my professional career and I will not repeat what my resume says. To sum it all up, I've been with Cisco for over 8 years. I was integral in the establishment of the Human Resources Connection (HRC) in RTP, NC and worked extensively in the department as a specialist and the SME for Compensation, as well as, for Payroll. I had significant input into both the establishment of the RTP center and process improvements with service delivery. I was also instrumental in the rollout of Compensation Planner and the training of the HRC representatives, as well as, end users for the Mid Year Focal and Year End Focal Planning Initiative. My position within the HRC AND prior roles provided me with a unique experience set into HR Operations at Cisco.  
 
After my time in the HRC I transitioned to Talent Acquisition Global Operations working as a Talent Acquisition (TA) Systems Support Administrator. This role has allowed me to be responsible for support and guidance to all global TA System (VirtualEdge) related issues and inquiries. I have honed my research skills and have been responsible for testing configuration changes, as well as, new functionality prior to production rollout to the end-users. I also perform tasks such as periodic audits to ensure data integrity, access management, etc. 
 
Additionally, I was the lead on a few projects that are listed. 
 
Lastly, I am trained in DMAIC methodology (define,measure, analyze, improve and control) as well as multi-task. 
 
That's me. Summary If you're looking to connect with me socially then you can find me on Facebook.

Experience HR Analyst-Talent Acquisition/Global Operations Cisco Systems July 2010  – Present (5 years 2 months) RTP, NC Responsible for support and guidance to all global Talent Acquisition (TA) System (VirtualEdge) related issues and inquiries. This role is the point of contact for all escalations from the GBS Employee Experience team where the local support team cannot resolve a case. The TA Systems Support Administrator is also responsible for testing configuration changes as well as new functionality prior to production rollout to the end-users. Additionally, responsible for taking product suggestions/enhancements from the end-users to determine if the requirement can be met within the current system or if an enhancement will be needed. This involves obtaining end-user business requirements and working with other team members, including VirtualEdge, to provide an estimate of cost and time involved to support the requirement, which is presented to the Steering Committee for review. Also perform administrative tasks such as periodic audits to ensure data integrity, access management, agency setup and support in the VirtualEdge system, researching and removing suspect duplicate records and contacting and referring applicants to our external career center who have submitted paper resumes to Cisco. HRC Specialist II Cisco Systems October 2007  –  July 2010  (2 years 10 months) Work with a team of HR Professionals providing and helping resolve routine and complex HR-related questions, issues and escalations. Manage escalations that may also include special cases on-line or written requests coming from a variety of sources, including: Field HR, client managers, employees, etc. In addition, this role provides HR program support, which typically includes: Process maps, designs and improves processes where necessary. Implements and supports human resources corporate programs and policies; analyzing business situations from which answers can be readily obtained; leverages the expertise of people in other organizations to serve all facets of the employee's needs.
